snippet: The first visit to India by a Pakistani head of state in seven years was a small sign of progress. If they keep pursuing incremental steps, they may yet build a peace.
abstract: Editorial credits both Indian Prime Min Manmohan Singh and Pakistani Pres Asif Ali Zardari for their workmanlike effort to improve relations; expresses hope that their meeting, the first in seven years, represents progress toward a lasting peace; warns that no major breakthroughs will be possible until Pakistan prosecutes those responsible for the 2008 terrorists attacks in Mumbai.
lead_paragraph: The first visit to India by a Pakistani head of state in seven years was a small sign of progress. If they keep pursuing incremental steps, they may yet build a peace.

headline.seo: More Than Lunch for the Leaders of India and Pakistan
